thread.title: Watch: Girl grabs monster lizard by the tail in restaurant
thread.title_full: Watch: Girl grabs monster lizard by the tail in restaurant

title: Watch: Girl grabs monster lizard by the tail in restaurant
text: (Mimosa Wines/Facebook) Brings a whole new meaning to 'no pets allowed' Most restaurants have a strict rule about bringing pets in the dining area. After all, nobody wants to have a meal while a furry creature is scurrying around. When customers do have pets however, they are asked to leave them outside. That was certainly the case for this huge lizard; as it got dragged outside the restaurant premises. In the video captured by restaurant Mimosa Wines, a French waitress known as Samia is seen dragging the reptile out an Australian restaurant. The video has been making rounds in social media, with users admiring at the bravery of the 25-year old woman. Here are some of the best reactions to internet's new heroine. GOANNA GIRL, YOU ROCK. https://t.co/tOcogdqzwK - Ms Fizz (@gherd_erma) February 21, 2017 @Pseudony_Ms Goanna Girl would be a great superhero - Rogue Badger (@Michael_J_Parry) February 21, 2017 According to the Telegraph , she has since become known across the internet as the "goanna girl" for her actions. In some parts of the video, it can be seen that the 180cm long lizard fights back at her as she drags it by the tail - away from any customers that might lose their appetite. The same report quotes Samia as saying that she wasn't scared of the ordeal but instead was a "bit excited". Watch the video of 'goanna girl' in action below:
